head.title: Deal for Devils Is Delayed but Alive

hedline.hl1: Deal for Devils Is Delayed but Alive

abstract.p: Planned closing of Puck Holdings's $175 million purchase of New Jersey Devils has been delayed, but deal is still alive (S)

block.p: The planned closing of Puck Holdings's $175 million purchase of the Devils has been delayed, but the deal is still alive. The sale had been scheduled to close July 12 but will not be final for a few weeks.

''In my mind there is no doubt,'' said Harvey Schiller, chairman of YankeeNets, which would run the Devils as general partner. Puck Holdings was created by Lewis Katz and Raymond Chambers, part-owners of the YankeeNets, to acquire the Devils from John McMullen. ''Ray and Lewis have seen no problem, Schiller said.''

Buying the Stanley Cup champion Devils is crucial to the YankeeNets' plan for an arena in Newark and a regional cable sports network to carry the Yankees, Nets and Devils.
The delay in closing the Devils' purchase is being caused by the time needed for Katz and Chambers to assemble as many as six or eight additional investors.
Schiller said he hoped the investment lineup would be completed by the end of July and the sale of the Devils made final then or soon after.
